items.sentence: I suppose you\'ll be studying all day tomorrow.
We don\'t know much about Tom\'s personal life.
I\'m getting off the train at the next station.
I didn\'t know what else to do, so I just left.
I didn\'t know you were interested in antiques.
I didn\'t realize that Tom was in the hospital.
I didn\'t realize that Tom was married to Mary.
I didn\'t realize that you were feeling so bad.
I\'m not sure you\'re going to want to do that.
I\'m pretty sure Tom doesn\'t know how to swim.
I\'m sorry, but I didn\'t know it was a secret.
I\'m planning to move back to Boston next year.
I\'m pretty sure that Tom has done this before.
I\'ll write Tom a letter as soon as I get home.
I\'m afraid I spilled coffee on the tablecloth.
Don\'t believe everything you hear on the news.
Don\'t blame yourself for what happened to Tom.
I don\'t know the reason why she isn\'t coming.
Thirteen people were killed in the train wreck.
Tom was fast asleep when Mary entered the room.
